alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:46PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carbon and central Albany Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk Mountain, or 42 miles east of Rawlins, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk Mountain and Arlington. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 249 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range
